required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SI-B001 in the Treatment of Recurrent and Metastatic HNSCC
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of SI-B001 in the Treatment of Recurrent and Metastatic Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck

brief_summary.textblock:
The main purpose
- To evaluate the efficacy of SI-B001 monotherapy RP2D in phase I clinical treatment of recurrent and metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (non-nasopharyngeal carcinoma).
- To evaluate the safety and tolerability of SI-B001 monotherapy RP2D in phase I clinical treatment of recurrent and metastatic head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (non-nasopharyngeal carcinoma).
2) Secondary purpose
- Evaluate the PK characteristics of the SI-B001.
- Evaluate the immunogenicity of SI-B001. 3) Exploratory purpose
- Explore biomarkers that predict efficacy, such as protein expression and/or gene amplification of EGFR and/or HER3 in tumor pathology, and peripheral blood NRG1 levels.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum tolerated dose (MTD) or maximum administrated dose (MAD)

clinical_study.condition: Head and Neck Squamous Cell Carcinoma

arm_group.description: SI-B001 was administered weekly by intravenous infusion（QW）. The 4-week cycle was maintained until disease progression or cessation due to intolerable toxicity or other reasons (e.g., withdrawal of informed consent or death). From C1D1, efficacy was evaluated every 8 weeks ±7 days in the first year and every 12 weeks ±7 days in the second year.

condition_browse.mesh_term: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of Head and Neck
